courseDescription:
This free online Cryptography training course highlights the increasing need for knowledge about the security of systems and data in this modern digital age. You will learn about the paradigms and principles of modern Cryptography as well as the formal security definitions and constructions of various cryptographic primitives such as Message Authentication Codes, Hash Functions, Digital Signatures and more. The advanced applications of Cryptography will be outlined in the first section of the course. You will learn about the syntax and security definitions of the Symmetric-Key Encryption Scheme. The notion of Perfect Security and its limitations will also be discussed in this section.

Next, you will be introduced to the concepts of computational security where you will study the security properties of Pseudo-Random Generators and Stream Ciphers. You will also consider the practical and theoretical instantiations of Pseudo-Random Generators and the different modes of operations of Block Ciphers. Thereafter, you will learn about the applications of Message Authentication Codes and Cryptographic Hash functions. You will learn how to construct different security ciphers with the use of message authentication codes and cryptographic hash functions. In the next section, you will learn about the properties and various types of Cyclic Groups. You will also consider the relevance of this cryptographic primitive in the security of data.

Lastly, you will learn about the features of the Public key Cryptosystem and its various models. You will study the principles of Identification Schemes, Signature Schemes, Number Theory and Zero Knowledge Protocols; all of which are part of the Asymmetric-Key Encryption Scheme. This course is a great starting point for anyone who is looking to pursue a career in Cryptography or Cybersecurity. It will also be highly relevant to those who want to learn to improve the security of their systems and data. Why wait, start this course today!

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module presents an introduction to the science of Cryptography. It discusses the importance of cryptography and its relevance in the context of the current digital age. You will learn about the features of symmetric key cryptography such as perfect security, stream ciphers, message authentication codes and more.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, the approaches that are currently in use in modern cryptography will be discussed. Semantic security in the context of various cybersecurity attack models will be defined. You will also be introduced to reduction-based proofs and pseudo-random generators.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, the theoretical and practical instantiations of pseudo-random generators will be explained. You will also learn about the concept of one-way functions and the significance of pseudo-random functions in designing symmetric-key primitives.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn the various modes of operations of Block Ciphers that can be used to construct efficient cypher-plaintext-attack secure ciphers. The theoretical and practical constructions of Block Ciphers will also be explained.
topics: Modes of Operations of Block Ciphers
Output Feedback Mode and Counter Mode

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module discusses how to achieve message integrity and authenticity with the use of Message Authentication Codes. You will learn about the various ways of constructing these cryptographic primitives to carry out various functionalities and the principles of Information-theoretic message authentication codes.
topics: Message Authentication Codes for Long Messages
Construction of Information Theoretic Secure MACs

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will also learn about the various applications of cryptographic hash functions and how to construct different kinds of this cryptographic primitive. Some generic attacks on hash functions and how to prevent them will be discussed. The principles of the Random Oracle Model will also be explained.
topics: Hash Functions in the Random Oracle Model

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Advanced Diploma in Cryptography - First Assessment
modules.description: This module is the first assessment, which enables you to review your learning so you can determine your knowledge and understanding of module 1 - 6 of the course.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, the definitions and properties of cyclic groups will be discussed. You will also learn the various cryptographic hardness assumptions in cyclic groups, the features of the prime-order cyclic groups and the elliptic-curve based cyclic groups.
topics: Cyclic Groups based on Elliptic Curves

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, learn about the definitions and implications of authenticated encryption. The objectives of secure communication will be outlined and you will learn how to compose CPA-secure ciphers. The properties of key exchange protocols will also be highlighted.
topics: Composing CPA Secure Cipher and Secure MAC
Generic Constructions of Key Exchange Protocol

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, the concepts of public-key encryption are introduced. You will learn about the origins of public-key cryptography and its underlying architecture and syntax. The various schemes that are based on the public key cryptosystem will also be analyzed.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, learn about chosen-ciphertext-security for public-key cryptosystems. Public key ciphers, which are based on various security models, will also be discussed.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the various identification schemes and their properties. You will also learn about the concept of zero-knowledge protocols and their applications.
topics: Identification Schemes and Zero-Knowledge Protocol - Learning Outcomes
Identification Schemes and Zero-Knowledge Protocol - Lesson Summary

modules.description: This module is the second assessment, which enables you to review your learning so you can determine your knowledge and understanding of module 7 - 11 of the course.
